member.name: T:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.INavigableView`1
member.summary: A component whose ViewModel is separate from the DataContext and can be navigated by INavigationView.
member.typeparam: The type of the ViewModel associated with the view. This type optionally may implement to participate in navigation processes.

member.name: P:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.INavigableView`1.ViewModel
member.summary: Gets the view model used by the view. Optionally, it may implement and be navigated by INavigationView.

member.name: T:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.INavigationAware
member.summary: Notifies class about being navigated.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.INavigationAware.OnNavigatedToAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously handles the event that is fired after the component is navigated to.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.INavigationAware.OnNavigatedFromAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously handles the event that is fired before the component is navigated from.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.NavigationAware
member.summary: Provides a base class for navigation-aware components.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.NavigationAware.OnNavigatedTo
member.summary: Handles the event that is fired after the component is navigated to.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.Controls.NavigationAware.OnNavigatedFrom
member.summary: Handles the event that is fired before the component is navigated from.

member.name: T:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.INavigationViewPageProvider
member.summary: Defines a service that provides pages for navigation.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.INavigationViewPageProvider.GetPage(System.Type)
member.summary: Retrieves a page of the specified type.
member.param: The type of the page to retrieve.
member.returns: An instance of the specified page type, or null if the page is not found.

member.name: T:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.NavigationException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur during navigation.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.NavigationException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NavigationException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.NavigationException.#ctor(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NavigationException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
The message that describes the error.

member.name: T:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.NavigationViewPageProviderExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for the INavigationViewPageProvider interface.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.NavigationViewPageProviderExtensions.GetPage``1(Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.INavigationViewPageProvider)
member.summary: Retrieves a page of the specified type from the page service.
member.typeparam: The type of the page to retrieve.
member.returns: An instance of the specified page type, or null if the page is not found.

member.name: M:Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.NavigationViewPageProviderExtensions.GetRequiredPage``1(Wpf.Ui.Abstractions.INavigationViewPageProvider)
member.summary: Retrieves a page of the specified type from the page service. Throws a NavigationException if the page is not found.
member.typeparam: The type of the page to retrieve.
member.returns: An instance of the specified page type.
member.exception: Thrown when the specified page type is not found.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the priority of a member in overload resolution. When unspecified, the default priority is 0.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The priority of the attributed member. Higher numbers are prioritized, lower numbers are deprioritized. 0 is the default if no attribute is present.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.Priority
member.summary: The priority of the member.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ParamCollectionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method will allow a variable number of arguments in its invocation.
